pros: Everyone works together as a team and gets along. The patients make the job even more enjoyable. It’s not too hard or stressful. Patient ratio is 4:1. RN start at $33 minimum with no experience and they hire LPN. The food in the cafeteria is good. Parking is free.
cons: The pay is rising but still slightly behind other hospitals. Very rarely you get pulled to PG county for their capital region unit, maybe once every other year. Doesn’t give much education assistance.

pros: The babies are so sweet and the pay has gotten better. The teamwork is great . Everyone is really friendly and open to answering questions
cons: It can be a lot of work and a lot of heart breaking stories. Short staffing is a struggle too.

pros: Mt. Washington Pediatric Hospital pays its employees poorly compared to other facilities, to say the least. Employees that have stayed devoted to the company have suffered financially the worst by never having pay adjusted. I know of a nurse who had over 13 years experience not even making $36/hour. Also ratios are difficult and busy, unsafe at times. Currently as of 8/21 there are no permanent managers for either inpatient unit, as one stepped down and the other left to seek better employment. Many of the Charge Nurses are young and inexperienced as well as have never worked outside of Mt. Washington. Staff can be clicks as well, lots of gossiping.
great staff, a great place to START your career in health care
cons: the upper management not held accountable for their mistakes

pros: A very cool environment to work in.

cons: not a bad place to work

pros: The staff was friendly and helpful, low number of patients on workload, didn't feel bothered my management. Was able to work independently. No backstabbing co-workers.
cons: The pay rate was average for me, I don't really have anything else to say.

review_title: A place where childrens can help you to grow.
job_title: Patient Account Representative in Baltimore, MD
pros: Family oriented, very good insurance, nice salaries. Many activities that can help you to make a lot of friends. Flexibile schedule and gret benefits per general.Beautiful office , but a little crowdy.
cons: Training is not consistentant, need a lot of improvments. Old software - meditech- can create many problems if you do not have experience.

pros: Small company. Almost everyone knows everyone and is very friendly. Great mission and work is important. Pay is ok and so are benefits.
cons: Everyone knows everyone. Promotions and advancement are not always transparent. Management is solid and has been in place for a long time but is not always forward thinking.

pros: Coworkers in nutrition and food service department were fun to work with and nice
cons: Management was poor, pay was low but require a degree, and people quiet every 3 to 4 months which leave staff short all the time

job_title: Security Operation Supervisor in Security, MD
pros: Do your job to the fullest and dot all your I and Ts. Work with others and remember to check on what you do.
cons: Look out for yourself and always help others.

job_title: Manager of Environmental Service/Laundry in Baltimore, MD
pros: Positive place to work. People are very friendly and compassionate.

cons: it can be better for the pg very convience

job_title: Director of Environmental Services in Baltimore, MD
pros: Love work with people, and assuring their safety
cons: To many meetings , To long in making solutions.
